ratings.comment: A great guy, but if your not a math person he's almost too smart.  His tests are hard and if you don't understand every aspect of how to solve a problem, including how an equation is derived (unnecessary), then don't expect to succeed on the tests.  He's really funny, and very nice, but the grading is extremely picky.

Took one of the most difficult courses at the school (Multivariable calc) and made it so you can understand it.  The best thing about him is the fact he never tries to trick you on exams, basically if you try your hardest you should do fine.  A god among men compared to other math professors I've had.
What a legend. I'm glad I got to take a class with him before he retired.
He was a pretty easy teacher.  His lectures can be boring, and not a lot of material is covered always, but he is a funny guy and is really nice.  He's available in his office often for help as well.

An absolutely great professor. He did a great job of letting you know what you needed to know for exams and the homework was alot like exams. Probably the best math professor I have ever had. It's too bad that he decided to retire because he does a great job of teaching.
EXCELLANT prof!  I wish he was staying past this semester; he will be sorely missed.
Great professor that cared whether or not you understood the material. Tests very straight forward and i feel bad that no one else will get to have Bob again!

Prof. Wilson is the best! The history of math is not your average class, but he really makes you think. Leave it up to him to bring up a point to keep you awake at night. Drop by his office hours, too, even if you don't need to -- talking to him is a real treat, and you'll make a great friend. All-around wonderful guy!!!

If you get the chance, take a class with this man! He is an absolutely amazing professor and he tests you on things that he actually taught you, he's not out to trick you like all of the other math profs here. He has a great sense of humor once you pick up on it, and he is definitely one of the best professors I've ever had.

This didn't feel like the hardest class I've taken, but it was the lowest grade I've received. There is a lot of work and the tests are ridiculously difficult. Essentially, you need a ton of "tricks" to solve each problem. Grading was really unclear. Overall, Wilson is a pretty good professor. I feel like I learned a lot, but it didn't show.

Wilson is one math professor who actually knows how to explain things.  He made examples that were very clear and you can tell he is extremely well informed.  Exams had some tricky questions at times, but overall were similar to homework and practice exams.  Would definitely recommend him!

Class attendance isn?t mandatory but he goes through some examples that have been known to pop up on the exams.  He?s quite a funny guy who just really loves math. It?s really nice because he has lots of practice tests that you can take.  DEFINITELY recommend him!
I dont get where all the rumors about 222 being the hardest class here.  maybe the people who say that didnt have wilson because he makes it easy. Lectures can be very boring and useless though.
He MAKES MATH EASY!haha....He's definitely the best Math professor....Easy exams!! SO take his class you will get high grade! &.. someone said he's like a santa clause..I agree!LOL

He was an amazing teacher for calc 1.  I recommend him to anyone.  i did terrible in calc in high school and taking this class really made me understand it.  He lets you use like three pages of notes on every exam and the exams are extremely easy.  If you don't get at least a B in this class u messed up.

Wilson is a great calculus lecturer.  unfortunately, his classes are only early morning classes so you have to deal with that.  Make sure you get a good TA and get ready for some problems on exams that are ridiculously difficult and out of nowhere.  Calculus is hard, but you should be able to come out of this class with at least a B

Calc IS HARD -But Wilson is a good prof.  Do all the homework EVERY week/day.  If you get a bad grade it's your own fault and/or because Calc is hard.  _-I got a bad grade, and it IS my fault.--  Wilson=GOOD

He is a very caring person and wants you to do well.  Make sure you understand the reasoning behind why you use specific equations and such.  Try to get a good TA.  Wilson is very clear in lecture and probably the best professor you could get for calculus.
well, his class is comprehensible,easy to understand. And he never gives us homework!!The only thing u should be aware of is to choose a good TA!!!

His great-grandfather, his grandfather, his father and his daughter are all mathmatics professors. His grandmother would have been but chose to marry.  His brother was one but is now a CEO.  From his speech, he is intelligent.  He does theory and examples in lecture.  Exams are like practice exams. Know how to explain your answers. Do ALL hw assign
What a legacy. great teacher, hard class. willing to help though. i wouldn't ask for anyone else for 222

Wilson is one my only professors that have been on our side.  He actually cares about your understanding of the material, and he always makes sure you have the information available to help you succeed.  I didn't take advantage of these though, and I didn't do as well as I hoped. He is probably one of the best professors on campus.

A very funny prof.  He looks like Santa Claus.  His jokes can be quite wierd at times.  His exams come straight from the homework and old exams.  Study what he says is important: it will show up on exams.

Funniest Math teacher alive!  His corny jokes and playful personality made an otherwise dull lecture into a halfway interesting one.  He lets you use notes on the exams, which are GREATLY useful.  Study the practice exams and do all the suggested problems if you have time.  He repeats questions from time to time on the midterms.

Professor Wilson is one of the greatest math professors at Madison. He is very funny and he is never afraid to pull out a joke for the class. His tests are amazingly easy and he tests for a basic understanding of the material. I would strongly advise anyone to take his class if they want to escape the stereotypical tough calc course.
this guy is amazing! he keep his classes fun with small jokes and goes through everything very thoroughly.

Professor Wilson is very knowledgeable and great at explaining material without all the proofs and technical jargon.  Lectures can be boring, but are helpful.  Sometimes he likes to throw in some humor.  I imagine that he would be hard to beat for being the best calculus professor at the UW.
The Best Calculus teacher at madison by far.  If you have to take calculus take it with him.
most fantastic professot i ever had.  can get an easy A with one night study.
He's like Santa Claus....only he teaches calculus.
Excellent person, excellent professor.  Is very knowledgable and extremely personable.  Best professor I've had yet by far!

This is an awesome professor. Explains everything very well and answers every question you may have. Lets you use three pages of notes on your final along with a calculator.  Will meet with you if you want help with your homework. Take this professor!
The best professor ive had here at madison.  Lets you use a calculator and sheet of paper on all exams/quizes.  Take him!!
Easlily the best Math teacher I'll ever have here.

amazing, he never forgets who you are after one office visit, really good at visuals, "imagine a goldfish swimming in a tank of harding jell-o, discribe its path" i would take the class all over again
He's good****... funny and down to earth, he's great for teaching the big picture and not getting bogged down in x's and o's

I'm almost sad that I don't need any higher level math courses - I would take anything he teaches. Describes in a visual manner what you are computing, which I found very helpful. Overall great guy - I would not have survived this class if it weren't for Wilson, let alone actually have ENJOYED it. Bob Wilson!!
Knew what he was teaching.  Loved the jokes. Good guy.
Can be a difficult class but Wilson is definitely the best you can have for a math prof.  He's very entertaining and makes it worth it to go to lecture.
likes to talk a lot and doesn't do very many examples.  lectures are entertaining, but not helpful as far as exams go.
Don't even question it...TAKE HIM!!!
Will explain the world if you give him time.
The man's hilarious.
BEST TEACHER EVER!  Really funny and great at explaining HARD STUFF!  Lets you use calculators on tests, unlike most Calc teachers...  Take him if he is offered, for sure!

best math professor EVER.  he did an excellent job teaching calculus, especially 222, which is supposedly extremely hard.  i'd recommend him to anybody.  "we have nothing to sphere but spheres themselves!"

THE EASIEST PROFESSOR EVER!  lets you use notecards and graphing calculator on all exams!  lectures are boring but sometimes he gets off track and can be pretty funny.  looks like santa clause/colonel sanders from KFC.... quote - "we have nothing to sphere except spheres themselves."

Bob Wilson's jokes can be bad at times... but they definitly lighten up the subject matter.  He is an excellent math prof, very detailed in his explinations.  Tbe best aspect of Bob's teaching is that he will always go back over a problem he has completed and review his reasoning.  Take his class!!!
Very good prof.  Knows his materials, clear lectures and lets you use notecards for exams.  Also has a great sense of humor.  The best math prof Ive had here.

Extremely funny guy.  Looks like Santa Clause.  Exams are very easy and he lets you use notecards so put everything on a notecard.  Do the homework and you'll do fine.  I went to lectures to read the paper and go to sleep.  They are very boring when he talks math but sometimes he tells a funny joke.
wilson is great. explains the material very well. very funny too. exams are very straight forward. i had him for 221 and 234 and i'd take him again for any more math courses.

-------Great entertainment in class------------ "And what we have here is an enourmous Tool"  "Sin(x), not the nasal spray"  "If I had a few more hands, I'd do this with the umbrella"   "These aint these curves up here"   "I'll try... to screw up"   "And now would you like to try for less
Reminds me 100% of Colonel Sanders. Talks quite fast, but isn't difficult to understand. He's funny in his own little way. Tests are pretty reasonable.
Good teacher, slips his humor into classes. Talks fast but style is very easy to get used to. Had him for 221 and now 234, definately recommed him compared to the other math professors.

a fantastic professor!  I highly recommend taking his class!  I had a satellite course, so there were only 30 of us in the class and he made an effort to know each of us as individuals.  Very funny and very approachable.  just a great teacher in general

The course sucks in general.  Wilson is easy to approach and helpful in office hours.  Lectures were pretty useless (I slept through about half of them).  Mid-terms weren't too hard.  Final exam sucked.

Realistically, I hate/hated calculus, however, WIlson actively engaged me and helped me to overcome my general hatred towards higher level mathematics.  I hated the course, but loved the teacher...that should say something.
He talks very fast, and jumps around. Exams semi-hard. He does try to make class interesting tho.
he goes too much into detail in lectures. medium difficulty on tests. very picky on tests. take him if you have had calc before.
worthless lectures.... medium difficulty on tests
Loves teaching, will always the time when you have questions. Funny!

I had almost given up on math before this class...Definitely a class you want to go to every day, if you have Wilson.  Unlike too many math lectures, it will actually be worth your time.  His office hours are incredibly helpful if you have questions, and
Very tough course, but professor makes it bearable.  Assignments are posted online and emailed, so ditching class is a bit safer.  Curved the grades ALOT.  (250/400 was a C!!)
